intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. hegetschweileri, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions in Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures typical of the genus Hieracium. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique morphological features, including specific leaf shapes and flower coloration. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous or alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
